intro: Eriocaulon ubonense f. kradungense, commonly known as the Kradung swamp grass, is a rare and endemic plant species native to Thailand. It belongs to the family Eriocaulaceae, which includes plants adapted to wetland environments. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered inflorescences and narrow leaves, typical of its habitat. It thrives in swampy and marshy areas, often found in the southern regions of Thailand. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a valuable subject for botanical research and conservation efforts.
